TopicTitle: X-ray your craft to find lost struts

Articles.Content:
Hi Guys!! I've been having a break from KSP (RL's fault, nothing to do with KSP) but I've had a bit of time this week.

I thought I'd mention something I randomly discovered a couple days ago; a way to X-ray your craft.

Sometimes when building space planes you get a strut that is asymmetrically placed and it causes all kinds of problems (the least of which is it veering off the runway). It can sometimes be a real pain to locate that problem strut and before now I've restarted designs just because I couldn't find that one rouge strut.

BUT if you take a large part (best with one that doesn't radially attach) and hold it in front of the craft you get an X-ray view inside the craft and only certain parts are visible.

Take this plane (which actually was a complete fail!)

And then hold the large RCS tank infront of it;

You can see through the wings and some of the tanks, but the struts and some other parts remain visible. I have no idea what governs which parts become see-though, it seems like it makes the parts you have a direct line of sight to see though, but that's not quite it, otherwise it would have hidden the intakes.

Whatever it is, I've found this really useful in checking my strut placing in planes.
